intro: Swainsona phacoides, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant produces bright yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular inflorescences, which are a defining feature of the species. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Swainsona phacoides is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility.
